Job Title: Project Manager

Location: Salt Lake City, UT

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Information Technology, Project Management

Description:
What is the Opportunity? 

At Ovivo, we offer you the opportunity to expand your skills and professional experience while collaborating with worldwide experts in water treatment. As a Project Manager, you will be exposed to a variety of challenging objectives in a fast-moving environment. This important position is responsible for coordinating the day-to-day activities of assigned projects, including internal project launches, scheduling.

Joining Ovivo means being part of a global team of innovative and passionate professionals who are committed to preserving water, our planet's most critical resource. It also means combining our efforts and talents towards a more sustainable future - together.

The role is based in our Salt Lake City office where we enjoy a Hybrid work model.

 What is the role? 

 Work within a cross-functional team environment with Engineering and Marketing to execute assigned projects.  Work with internal engineering staff to provide specifications, specification reviews, general arrangement drawings, technical data, and other sales aid materials as required for support of customer needs for assigned projects.  Coordinate the overall profit and loss schedules for the deliverables for each project.  Creation of procurement schedules, deliverables lists and work breakdown schedules.  Facilitate project booking, design, development, delivery, completion, and profitability of assigned projects.  Monitor project schedules and communicate them with customers and various internal departments.  Participate in equipment start-up and provide technical training.  Evaluate market potential and recommend pursuing/not pursuing opportunities.  Recommend product improvements and standardizations.  Recommend improvements to overall Quality Assurance and Quality control.  Prepare accounting documents on progress and final invoicing.  Act as company liaison with customers and reply promptly to their inquiries.  Evaluate and manage warranty claims.  Maintain CRM assets and warranty cases.  Other duties as assigned. 

 Does this sound like you? 

 Bachelor's degree in a related field or a minimum of 5 years of directly applicable technical experience.  Mechanically inclined person preferred.  Proficient in the use of MS Office products.  Proven history of excellent customer service.  CRM management experience is a plus.  Ability to work independently and reliably.  Travel up to 10%.  Knowledge of principles of Project Management.  Ability to read, analyze, and interpret complex industry related technical documents.  Ability to identify areas of risk on a project and development strategies to mitigate risk.  Ability to respond effectively to sensitive inquiries and complaints .  Ability to understand and read, write and converse in English at an advanced level.  Must be able to communicate on a technical level, verbally and in writing, and deliver presentations.  Must have demonstrated interpersonal and customer relations skills. 

 Don't meet every single requirement? If you carry a strong sense of ownership and teamwork in everything you do, we'd like to hear from you any way. 

 Why work at Ovivo? 

 Medical, Dental and Vision benefits  401k Match  Company paid life insurance along with company paid short and long-term disability  11 paid holidays  Three weeks of PTO to start (hire date determines number of PTO hours for the first year)  Roll over of 40 PTO hours to the following year  Sixteen personal hours (hire date determines number of personal hours for the first year)  Days off between Christmas Eve and New Year's Day - paid by the company with no impact to PTO balance.  Profit sharing 

At Ovivo we are committed to providing working environments where everyone is included and treated fairly and with respect. Dive in - Apply Today! Let's change the future of water together.

About Ovivo

Ovivo is a global provider of equipment, technology, and systems producing among the purest water and treating some of the most challenging wastewater in the industry. Ovivo is a powerful global brand with renowned trademarks, possessing more than 150 years of expertise and references in water treatment, supported by its proprietary products, advanced technologies, and extensive system integration knowhow. Ovivo delivers conventional to highly technological water treatment solutions for the industrial and municipal markets and leverages its large installed base of equipment around the world to offer parts and services to its customers. Ovivo is dedicated to innovation in an industry that is in constant evolution and offers water treatment solutions that are cost-effective, energy-efficient, and environmentally sustainable.

Visit our website to learn more about Ovivo : https://careers.ovivowater.com/

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
